title: Aleem condoles with Azerbaijani ambassador over loss of lives in airplane crash
content:
ISLAMABAD, Dec 27 (APP):Federal Minister for Privatization, Board of Investment & Communications, Abdul Aleem Khan, visited the Azerbaijani Embassy here on Friday, where he expressed his deep sorrow over the tragic plane crash in Azerbaijan. Aleem Khan offered his condolences to the Ambassador of Azerbaijan, H.E. Khazar Farhadov, and extended heartfelt sympathy to the families of the victims.
Aleem Khan conveyed his profound grief, calling the loss of innocent lives in the plane accident deeply saddening. He emphasized the strong bond between Pakistan and Azerbaijan, noting that the two countries share a unique brotherly relationship, where the joys and sorrows of one are felt by the other.
“I have come here not just to express my condolences to Ambassador Khazar Farhadov but also to stand by him as a brother in this difficult time,” said Aleem Khan. He also offered prayers for the souls of the deceased and wished for the swift recovery of the injured.
In his remarks, Ambassador Farhadov expressed his gratitude to Aleem Khan for his visit and kind words. Farhadov thanked the people of Pakistan for their heartfelt sympathy, adding that such gestures of solidarity were deeply appreciated. “May Allah Almighty protect every country from such accidents and shower blessings upon us,” the ambassador said.
